page.title: 17EATING HABITS
page.content: Many local dishes are common to North of England and Scotland. {Breakfast.} Tea/coffee, bacon and egg, toast with marmalade, jam or honey. Fruit. {Main meal}-generally in evening except for farmers and retired. Fast food is popular with working mothers, and curry and spaghetti are more common. A roast is still eaten on Sundays with Yorkshire pudding, turkey at Christmas, and ham and pease pudding with beetroot at showtime. Other dishes are rabbit pie, leek puddings, tatie cake and fish. {Lunch}is often a 'bait' of sandwiches or pies. Teacakes, scones, cakes and fruit pies are all made regularly, and jam and chutney. Mince pies are a must at Christmas, and dyed or 'pace' eggs at Easter. Wines are also made at home.
